message: Disk IO is a big bottleneck, here is how to speed it up a little bit
story: Mohammad Fouad shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: You are using your Hard Drive wrong, C is faster than D! - DevMasr
caption: devmasr.com
description: On which partition you put your files will affect how fast you can access them. You can get more speed from your old Hard Disk Drive.

data.message: I kind of assumed that the data would be more spread out at the outer circles, after all, people talk about "sectors" on a disk, and in geometry sectors are arks on a circle defined by their angle (not length), so this is why I made that assumption. Apparently I was wrong :D
reminds me of  an introduction to PC course I did at IBM back in 1993 :)
Putting data in the same partition as the OS will cause fragmentation, which will considerably increase disk read time

The instructor explained this concept in the  introduction to PC course and the students complained that he was wasting their time with useless information :) I guess I could say that I was hurt more by ignorant people than I was ever hurt by evil ones. In fact, evil ones could do good things sometimes, but the ignorant, they are like Zombies infected with a virus, they are like the undead :)
